sense.name: disturb; stir up; shuffle
sense.commentary:
Includes: RUFFLE UP
NP1[+agent] RUFFLE (UP) NP2[-animate, +concrete]
sense.examples: Frantically, she ruffled through the papers. The chicken ruffled its feathers when the fox ran by. If you ruffle the surface of the water, you'll scare the fish. She turned the TV off and ruffled up the bed.

sense.name: upset; trouble; discompose
sense.commentary:
Includes: RUFFLE FEATHERS (metaphorical usage), RUFFLE UP
NP1[+theme/+agent] RUFFLE (PP) NP2[+human]
sense.examples: This play will ruffle the upper class. She has a way of ruffling feathers around the office. Lady Macky ruffles easily because of her delicate sensibilities.

sense.name: strut around usu. to impress someone
sense.examples: He ruffled around the party looking like a peacock.

sense.name: gather into pleats
sense.examples: To make a good curtain, you have to ruffle it at the top.
